title: Separate Constants and Variables on Either Side of the Equation
text: We must first simplify each side of the equation to get $$4x-4-2=10x+15+6$$
speech: We must first simplify each side of the equation to get  4 x minus 4 minus 2 is equal to, 10 x plus 15 plus 6

title: Simplify
text: Organize the constant to the same side to obtain $$6x=-27$$
speech: Organize the constant to the same side to obtain , 6 x is equal to negative 27

title: Division
text: We must make the coefficient of the variable equal to $$1$$, so we divide by $$6$$ on both sides to get $$x=\frac{-9}{2}$$
